cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi (160 km) SE of Fort Lauderdale, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, then turning north-northwest and north along/off the Southeast U.S. coast toward the Georgia–South Carolina coast and into the Carolinas/Mid-Atlantic early Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina/North Carolina border (Myrtle Beach–Wilmington area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC (does not yet include NC)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Boca Raton FL to Volusia/Flagler County Line; Tropical Storm Warning North of Ocean Reef FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL, Lake Okeechobee, Volusia/Flagler County Line to Ponte Vedra Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coast from Florida through North Carolina and New England over next 5 days
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with higher gusts possible late Monday night through Tuesday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 2–4 ft above ground level along the southeast NC coast including the Cape Fear River entrance
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–5 inches with isolated amounts to 7 inches, producing flash and urban flooding and rises on local rivers
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents; brief tornadoes in outer rainbands
